questions.neutral: You know your way around down here?

hobby.message: The city looks different through analog photography, doesn’t it?
Find any ghosts in the tunnels?
The Council would flinch at your political literature stash.

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Sure, I’ve seen a few hidden corners in Stenograd.
Spent spare time in old transit tunnels, keeps me busy.
My hobby’s urban exploring, nothing much to it.
These days, crowds get everywhere since the graffiti mess.
Yeah, I know the underlayers pretty well.
I do urban exploration—utility tunnels, data bunkers, spots folks skip.
Keeps me ahead on city quirks and system outages.
Harder lately, with everyone chasing BCI graffiti or jury streams.
Folk aren’t subtle anymore, even in quiet basements.
Yeah, I get around some odd places, not just for work.
Urban exploring’s my fix. Old maintenance shafts, sealed data rooms, that sort.
Nobody used to care, but now everyone’s poking around—BCI drama spilled over.
Used to find peace. Lately it’s jury-watchers and would-be liberators every other crawl.
Had one of my spots hijacked for a neighborhood tribunal last weekend.
Can’t enjoy a real quiet circuit these days.
Spend half my life in the guts of this city—work and hobby both.
Urban exploration: sealed reactor basements, legacy server farms—places even Council forgets.
Started when system bugs sent me after phantom outages. Never stopped.
City was different when no one noticed what ran beneath our feet.
Now, even the hobby’s crowded—folk chasing after cryptic graffiti and makeshift jury meetings.
Had kids livestreaming from an old relay room I counted as mine.
Funny. My secret’s become everyone’s proving ground for BCI stories these days.
You could say the undercity raised me—my father ran diagnostics for the old regime.
Urban exploration keeps me sane—real shadows, real concrete, nothing staged by Council.
I track abandoned datacenters, old ventilation grids, even Halden’s first routing boxes—most are off-grid now.
Started mapping the old lines after my first BCI lockout. Felt freer below ground.
Nowadays, my circuits are full of would-be revolutionaries—BCI leaks made every tunnel political turf.
Had a jury crew set up shop right in my drinking spot last week.
Lost more than quiet—they flagged me for association in public feeds. Barely kept my score above fifty.
Funny how the city’s deepest secrets turned into everyone’s open trial these days.
hobby_answer: Not really boring. Always something broken down to see.
These days, seems like everyone’s wandering where they shouldn’t be.
With all the citizen juries, old tunnels aren’t quiet anymore.
I keep to myself. Not much in it for me lately.
People get too curious, that’s when you leave.
No, doesn’t get boring. Still poking around where the system’s thin.
Used to be a lonely hobby, now everyone’s tagging along.
Since the leak, all those ‘jury’ types keep popping up underground.
Watched them livestreaming in a data vault last week. Odd crowd.
Makes you rethink which corners are worth visiting.
Quiet’s been harder to find.
Never found it boring. Always something unexpected in those tunnels.
Lately, though, crowds have caught on—especially after those BCI leaks.
Ran into a bunch livestreaming their jury meeting down by Strelica station.
I used to drink in peace down there. Now it’s like a public square.
Solitude’s tough when everyone’s suspicious and poking around for secrets.
Used to trade tips with old-timers. Now it’s strangers with livestreams.
Kind of ruins the charm, but that’s Stenograd these days.
Urban exploration’s the only thing that clears the static in my head.
But last week, Strelica substation was swarming with citizen jury folks.
Apparently, tunnels are perfect venues for those livestreamed hearings now.
They brought all this equipment. Treated me like I was some system snitch.
Didn’t use to see anyone there—now it’s busy even after midnight.
I lost a favorite haunt to amateur investigators and nosy amateurs.
Feels like everyone’s churning up old ghosts since Halden died.
Miss the days you could just drink and listen to the transformers hum.
Never boring for me. Honestly, those tunnels kept me sane back when I was state-side.
Started sneaking around them before the BCI, back when you needed a real map.
Now, after Halden and the council secrets, everyone’s looking for evidence everywhere.
Last week I found a data vault packed with ‘citizen jurors’—they knew who I was.
They tried to draft me into their little investigation right there in the vault.
Nowadays, feels like the city’s forgotten what quiet used to sound like.
Can’t blame people for digging. The system’s got everyone spooked after those leaks.
Still. Exploration used to be for the curious. Now it’s all about finding scapegoats.
Sometimes I miss fixing things for their own sake, not ‘evidence collection.’
